attributes.action: Decolonise the UK school curriculum and taught material across all subjects
attributes.additional_details: UK universities have already started to pave the way to decolonise their teaching material, and I would like this petition to advocate for British schools to do the same. By reviewing Western/ Euro-centric material in British schools, and elevating the resources, voices and culture of non-Western historians, poets, storytellers and countries (to name a few), children will learn to deeply engage with perspectives that differ from their own, and build towards a more socially just society.
attributes.background: Critically review the taught material (books, and resources) as well as the core, taught curriculum for all subjects across UK schools, to remove the dominant perspectives of Western/ Euro-centric writers and academics and replace with more diverse literature, voice and material.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

 

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808 

 

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961 

 

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092 

 

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934
